These Dahlia are known for their ability to thrive in a variety of climates and soil conditions, making them a popular choice for gardeners and flower enthusiasts alike. The blooms of the Cornel Dahlia are characterized by their full, round shape and striking colors. They produce red flowers, these flowers are sure to add a burst of color to any garden or landscape. The blooms typically measure 4-6 inches in diameter and are carried atop strong, sturdy stems that can reach heights of up to 3 feet. One of the unique features of the Cornel Dahlia is its long blooming season, which typically runs from summer thru Fall. This extended flowering period means that gardeners can enjoy the beauty of these flowers for a longer period. Cornel Dahlia are relatively easy to grow, requiring only well-drained soil and regular watering. They are also known for their ability to multiply quickly, making them an excellent choice for those looking to expand their flower beds or create a more vibrant garden. Cornel Dahlia Bulbs can be used in a variety of ways, from creating beautiful cut flower arrangements to enhancing the overall beauty of a garden. They are also a popular choice for adding color and interest to large containers or pots on patios and decks. When properly cared for, Cornel Dahlia Bulbs can last for many years and will continue to produce beautiful blooms year after year. They are a great investment for anyone looking to create a stunning, long-lasting garden or landscape design.

These bulbs are easy to plant and maintain, and will bloom in the summer. They are perfect for adding a touch of elegance to any outdoor space, and make a great cut flower for arrangements. Verrone's Obsidian Dahlia Bulbs are sure to make a statement in any garden, and are sure to be a conversation starter among friends and family. In addition to their striking color, Verrone's Obsidian Dahlia Bulbs are also known for their large blooms that can reach up to 8 inches in diameter. Verrone's Obsidian Dahlia grow to be about 3-4 feet tall, making them perfect for planting in the back of a flower bed or as a focal point in a garden. These bulbs are also great for cut flowers, as the large blooms last for a long time when cut and placed in a vase. They are also great for attracting pollinators to your garden, such as bees and butterflies. Verrone's Obsidian Dahlia are hardy in zones 8-11 and can be planted in full sun or partial shade. With proper care, these bulbs will come back year after year, making them a great investment for your garden.

TITLE: Votaniki Dahlia Lavender Blush Mix Tuber - Perennial, Large Blooms, Dahlia Dinnerplate Lavender Blush Tubers for Planting - Hardy and Reliable for Yearly Blooms (3 Pack)
DESCRIPTION: Dahlia Lavender Blush Mix is a stunning addition to any garden or flower bed. This collection of dahlias features a range of lavender and blush shades, with each bloom showcasing a unique blend of colors. These tubers are easy to plant and care for, making them perfect for both novice and experienced gardeners. They thrive in full sun to partial shade and prefer well-drained soil. With regular watering and occasional fertilization, these dahlias will produce large, vibrant blooms throughout the summer and into the fall. The Dahlia Lavender Blush Mix Tubers is a versatile choice, adding elegance and charm to both formal and informal garden settings. They look fantastic planted in groups or as a stand-alone feature in a container garden. Plus, they make excellent cut flowers, bringing their beauty indoors to enjoy. Dahlia Lavender Blush plants will grow to a height of 24-36 inches. Plant them in the spring after the last frost for blooms that will last until the first frost of the fall. With proper care, these dahlias will continue to bloom year after year, becoming a reliable and treasured part of your garden. They are also an excellent choice for cut flower arrangements, with each stem producing multiple blooms that are perfect for bouquets and centerpieces. Whether you're looking to add color to a border or create a statement planting, the Dahlia Lavender Blush Mix is an excellent choice. Their tall, upright habit and large, showy blooms make it a standout feature in any garden setting.

TITLE: Votaniki Goji Berry 1-2 Ft Plant - Perennial with High Yield Goji Berry Plant | Great for Home and Garden - Easy to Grow, Low Maintenance, and Self-Pollinating Goji Berry Plant! (4 Pack)
DESCRIPTION: The Votaniki Goji Berry plant is incredibly easy to care for and is adaptable to a variety of growing conditions. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires moderate watering. It is also a self-fertile plant, which means you only need one plant to produce a bountiful harvest. Goji berries have a slightly sweet and tangy flavor and can be eaten as a snack, added to smoothies or salads, or used in cooking and baking. They are also a popular ingredient in traditional Chinese cuisine, particularly in soups and teas. Goji Berry plant is also known for its ornamental value. Its graceful, arching branches and delicate foliage make it a striking feature in any landscape design. It can be used as a focal point in a garden bed or as a natural screen to provide privacy and shade. During the growing season, it is important to fertilize your Goji Berry plant every few weeks with a balanced fertilizer. Regular pruning is also recommended to promote a healthy and productive plant. Trim back any dead or damaged branches and prune for shape. If you're looking for a plant that is both beautiful and nutritious, the Goji Berry plant is a perfect choice. With its vibrant berries and easy care requirements, it is sure to be a beloved addition to your garden.

TITLE: Votaniki Spectacle Dahlia Bulbs - Perennial Dahlia Bulb for Planting, Perfect for Garden Beds and Borders - Long Lasting Blooms, Versatile and Low Maintenance Plants (18 Pack)
DESCRIPTION: Spectacle Dahlia is known for their eye-catching, show-stopping blooms that come in orange with white color. The flowers are large and full, featuring multiple layers of delicate petals that create a lush and textured appearance. Spectacle Dahlia Bulbs are easy to plant and care for, making them perfect for both novice and experienced gardeners. They prefer full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil. Once planted, the bulbs will quickly grow into healthy plants with lush foliage and abundant blooms. These Dahlia are also highly versatile and can be used in a variety of ways, such as in garden beds, borders, containers, or even as cut flowers for arrangements. Their long-lasting blooms make them perfect for adding a pop of color and texture to any space. Spectacle Dahlia typically blooms from mid-summer to early fall, depending on the climate and growing conditions. Their long flowering period means you can enjoy their stunning blooms for several months. The Dahlia plants can grow up to 3-4 feet tall, making them perfect for adding vertical interest to your garden or landscape. They also have a bushy growth habit, with multiple stems emerging from each bulb. Spectacle Dahlia requires minimal maintenance, but they do need regular watering and occasional fertilization to thrive. Deadheading spent blooms will encourage the plant to produce more flowers. After the first frost, the bulbs can be dug up and stored indoors for the winter, then replanted in the spring.

TITLE: Votaniki White Christmas Caladium Bulbs - Long Blooming, Striking Beauty for Any Garden, Perennial Caladium Bulbs for Planting - Low Maintenance and Easy to Grow (3 Pack)
DESCRIPTION: The White Christmas Caladium is a stunning addition to any garden or indoor space. Christmas Caladium produces large, heart-shaped leaves that are primarily white with green veins and edges. The leaves have a glossy finish that adds a touch of elegance and sophistication to any setting. Caladium bulbs are easy to plant and care for, making them perfect for gardeners of all skill levels. They prefer well-draining soil and a warm, humid environment. The bulbs can be planted in the ground or in containers and should be watered regularly to keep the soil moist. One of the most striking features of the White Christmas Caladium is its versatility. They can be used as a focal point in a garden bed, as a border plant, or as a statement piece in a container garden. Their bright white leaves also make them an excellent choice for shady areas, as they reflect light and brighten up darker spaces. Caladium typically blooms in the summer and can continue to produce leaves well into the fall. When the leaves eventually begin to die back, the bulbs can be dug up and stored for the winter, ready to be replanted in the spring. White Christmas Caladium is also known for its air-purifying properties. They are excellent at removing harmful toxins from the air, making them a perfect choice for indoor spaces such as offices, bedrooms, and living rooms. In addition to their air-purifying benefits, these plant are also attractive to pollinators, making them a great addition to any garden that aims to attract bees, butterflies, and other beneficial insects.

Another benefit of the Allstar Strawberry plant is its versatility. This plant can be grown in a variety of soils and can even be grown in pots, making it ideal for those with limited garden space. Its compact size also makes it a great choice for small gardens or balcony gardens, where space is limited. Whether you want to grow strawberries in a garden bed, containers or hanging baskets, the Allstar Strawberry Roots is a versatile choice that is sure to bring a sweet touch to any outdoor space.

DESCRIPTION: Votaniki Dahlia Pastel Mix bulbs are a blend of different varieties of dahlia flowers in pastel colors. They are usually planted in the spring and bloom in the late summer or fall. Dahlias are known for their large, showy blooms in a wide range of colors and can be grown in many climates. They are typically planted in full sun and well-drained soil, and require regular watering and fertilization for optimal growth and blooming. Dahlias are a popular choice for gardens and flower beds because of their large, colorful blooms and long blooming period. They are also a popular cut flower and can be used in bouquets and arrangements. The Dahlia Pastel Mix bulbs that you mentioned are a great option for those who want a variety of pastel colored flowers in their garden. These bulbs will produce a range of dahlia flowers in shades such as pink, lavender, and white. When planting dahlia bulbs, it is important to choose a sunny location with well-drained soil. The bulbs should be planted about 4-6 inches deep and spaced about 18-24 inches apart. Watering and fertilizing regularly will help promote healthy growth and abundant blooming. Dahlias are generally easy to care for, but they can be susceptible to pests and diseases such as powdery mildew, aphids, and slugs. Regularly inspecting the plants and treating any issues promptly can help prevent problems. Deadheading, or removing spent blooms, can also encourage the plants to produce more flowers.

TITLE: Votaniki Red Dwarf Burning Bush Shrub - (Euonymus Alatus) Starter Plants from Cutting 1-2' Tall Outdoor Plants - Red Flowering Shrubs and Bushes Hedge Plants
DESCRIPTION: Dwarf Burning Bush Ready to plant Shrubs and Bushes These dwarf burning bushes stay green outside in spring and which converts in the bright red colored leaves that's why they are called burning bush, in winters the leaves fall and have thick windbreak branches with red berries on branches making it more attractive in winters. PlantingIn planting your burning bush, the following steps are recommended:. Choose a site with full sunlight to partial shade, full sun, if possible.. Dig a hole two to three times the height and width of the root ball.. Remove the shrub from the container it came in and loosen the roots gently with fingers.. Set a burning bush in the hole, with the root ball’s top edge either at or slightly above the level of the surrounding ground.. Backfill the hole with soil, tamping down to remove air pockets, then water the area deeply.. Apply a 2-3 inch layer of mulch over the root zone, careful not to touch the trunk.. To create a hedge, plant BB at 5-7 feet apart. Applications of Red Bush PlantThe shrubs for planting outdoors really look great when planted in clusters of 5 or more, at the corner of garden bushes and plants draw the attention in fall when these dwarf plants have red leaves, flowering bushes for shade can be used as a foundation plant, these are also good screening plants.

TITLE: Votaniki Phlox Mix Roots - Long Blooming, Versatile, Perennial Phlox Roots for Planting | Sweet Smelling Flowers All Summer Long - Ideal for Container Gardens or Ground Plantings (3 Pack)
DESCRIPTION: Votaniki Phlox Mix Roots - Phlox is a perfect addition to any garden or landscape design. These vibrant Phlox plants produce clusters of fragrant flowers, making them a popular choice for gardeners who want to add a pop of color to their outdoor space. our Phlox Mix Roots come as a collection of high-quality root cuttings that are ready to be planted directly into the soil. With proper care, these roots will quickly establish themselves and produce beautiful blooms for years to come. These hardy plants are easy to grow and require little maintenance, making them an ideal choice for both novice and experienced gardeners. They prefer full sun or partial shade and require well-draining soil to thrive. The Phlox plans can grow up to 2 feet in height and spread up to 3 feet wide, making them an excellent choice for borders, garden beds, and containers. The fragrant flowers of the Phlox will attract pollinators such as butterflies and hummingbirds, adding another layer of interest to the garden. They also make great cut flowers, allowing you to bring the beauty of your garden indoors. One of the best things about Phlox is its ability to bloom for an extended period. They typically bloom from mid-summer to early fall, providing color and interest during a time when many other plants have stopped blooming. The flowers themselves are small and delicate, but they grow in dense clusters, creating a carpet of color. When planting Phlox Mix Roots, it's important to space them about 12-18 inches apart to allow for adequate airflow. Regular watering during the first growing season will help establish the roots, after which they should be able to tolerate some periods of drought.

The flower form of Seattle is similar to that of a Zinnia, but they're fuller, which adds pleasant abundance to late-season gardens when other plants begin to fade. TITLE: Votaniki Giant Lancifolium Tiger Lily Bulbs | Fragrant, Vibrant Colors | Easy to Grow | Perfect for Garden Borders, Cut Flowers, and Naturalizing (12 Pack)
DESCRIPTION: Votaniki Tiger Lily bulb is a bulbous perennial plant that produces large, brightly colored flowers with distinctive black spots. These bulbs are easy to grow and can be planted in a variety of soils and conditions, making them a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. They typically bloom in the summer and can reach up to 4 feet in height. Tiger lily bulbs are hardy in zones 3-9. They are a great addition to any garden and are perfect for cut flowers. They can be planted in spring or fall, and will come back year after year. Tiger Lily bulbs have large, showy flowers that come in a range of colors, including Orange with polka dots. They are popular with hummingbirds, butterflies and are a great choice for naturalizing in a wildflower garden. To plant Tiger Lily bulbs, you can simply dig a hole, place the bulb in the hole, and cover it with soil. They prefer well-drained soil and a location that receives full sun or partial shade. It is important to plant the bulbs at the correct depth, usually about twice the height of the bulbs. And do not forget to water them well after planting.

TITLE: Votaniki Plum Tart Gladiolus Bulbs for Planting - Large Booms, Perennial Gladiolus Plant - Perfect for Garden - Easy to Grow and Low Maintenance (6 Pack)
DESCRIPTION: The Votaniki Plum Tart Gladiolus is a stunning flowering plant that produces tall spikes of plum-colored blooms with white throats. This plant is a hybrid that was bred specifically for its unique coloration and vigorous growth habits, making it an excellent addition to any garden or landscaping project. The bulbs of the Plum Tart Gladiolus are easy to plant and care for, making them a great choice for gardeners of all skill levels. Each bulb produces a single spike that can reach up to 4 feet in height, with multiple blooms opening along the stem. The flowers themselves are a rich plum color, with contrasting white throats that add depth and texture to the overall appearance. The Plum Tart Gladiolus blooms in mid to late summer, adding a burst of color to your garden just when you need it most. These Gladiolus are also great for cutting and using in floral arrangements, as the tall spikes and striking coloration make them a standout addition to any bouquet. In addition to their beauty, Plum Tart Gladiolus bulbs are also incredibly versatile and can be grown in a variety of settings. They are perfect for adding color and texture to garden beds, borders, and even containers. They are also ideal for planting in large groups or as a focal point in a mixed perennial bed. When planting Plum Tart Gladiolus bulbs, it is important to select a location with well-draining soil and full sun exposure. These bulbs prefer moist soil, so be sure to water them regularly and keep them well-hydrated throughout the growing season. In addition, you can fertilize them with a high-phosphorus fertilizer to encourage robust growth and blooming. As the blooms begin to fade, you can remove them to encourage the plant to produce more flowers. Once the growing season has ended, you can dig up the bulbs and store them in a cool, dry place until the next planting season. With proper care and maintenance, your Plum Tart Gladiolus bulbs can last for many years, providing you with a beautiful burst of color and texture each summer.

TITLE: Votaniki Black Touch Dahlia Bulbs - Perennial, Long Lasting Blooms | Fast Growing Dahlia Bulbs for Planting - Eye Catching Garden Displays (2 Pack)
DESCRIPTION: Votaniki Black Touch Dahlia is a beautiful and unique addition to any garden. These Dahlia bulbs produce striking, dark, velvety blooms that are almost black in color. The flowers are large and double-layered, giving them a lush and full appearance. They can reach a diameter of up to 4 inches, making them an eye-catching feature in any garden bed or container. These bulbs are easy to plant and care for, making them an excellent choice for both experienced and novice gardeners. They should be planted in a sunny location with well-draining soil. The bulbs should be planted at a depth of around 6 inches and spaced about 12 inches apart to allow for proper growth and development. Once planted, Black Touch Dahlia requires regular watering and feeding to encourage strong, healthy growth. They should be watered deeply once a week, and a balanced fertilizer can be applied every two to three weeks during the growing season. The dark, velvety blooms of Black Touch Dahlia make them an excellent choice for adding depth and contrast to any garden. These flowers are particularly stunning when paired with other brightly colored flowers or set against a light-colored background. Black Touch Dahlia also makes a striking addition to cut flower arrangements, adding an unexpected touch of drama and elegance. Black Touch Dahlia typically bloom from mid-summer through to the first frost, producing an abundance of flowers that can last for several weeks. They grow to a height of around 3 to 4 feet and have a bushy, compact habit that makes them ideal for use in garden borders or as a focal point in a container garden.

These bulbs produce stunning blooms in shades of white, yellow, and pink that open up during rainy seasons, earning them their name "Rain Lilies". These perennials are easy to grow and care for, and will come back year after year with minimal effort. They are perfect for borders, rock gardens, and as cut flowers. The mix pack contains a variety of colors, ensuring a lovely display of vibrant blooms in your garden. These bulbs are also drought-tolerant, making them a great choice for gardens in arid climates. Rain Lily are versatile plants that can grow in a range of soil types, as long as they are well-drained. They are also well-suited to both full sun and partial shade, making them ideal for a variety of planting locations. Rain Lily bulbs are very easy to plant and care for, simply plant them in the fall and they will emerge in the spring, with blooms appearing in late summer and early fall. Rain Lily are low maintenance and can be left to grow on their own, but deadheading spent blooms can encourage reblooming. These bulbs are also very hardy, and can withstand extreme temperatures and tough growing conditions. The Rain Lily Mix Bulbs are a great choice for gardeners of all skill levels and are sure to provide years of enjoyment with their beautiful blooms.

TITLE: Votaniki Ismene Festalis Flowering Bulbs - Fragrant Peruvian Daffodil Bulbs for Planting | Attracts Hummingbirds and Butterflies, Sweet Fragrance - Easy to Grow Hymenocallis Festalis (4 Pack)
DESCRIPTION: Ismene Festalis, also known as the "Peruvian daffodil," is a bulbous perennial plant that produces large, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white. The flowers bloom in late spring and early summer, and are known for their sweet fragrance. Ismene Festalis bulbs are easy to grow and care for, making them a great choice for both experienced and novice gardeners. Festalis bulbs can be planted in a variety of soils and conditions, but prefer well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. Festalis are also drought tolerant, which makes them a great choice for low maintenance gardens. Ismene Festalis bulbs are hardy in zones 8-10 and can be stored in a cool dry place over winter and replanted in spring. Add some beauty and fragrance to your garden with Ismene Festalis bulbs! In addition to their beautiful flowers, Ismene Festalis also have attractive, long, narrow leaves that provide a nice contrast to the flowers. They typically reach a height of 1-2 feet and spread of 6-8 inches. They look great when planted in groups or as borders, and can also be grown in pots or containers. The bulbs can be planted in the fall, allowing them to establish roots before the winter. They will then emerge from the ground in the spring, with flowers appearing a few weeks later. Ismene Festalis is also known to be deer-resistant, making them a great option for gardens where deer are a problem. They also attract hummingbirds and butterflies to the garden, providing an additional source of entertainment for gardeners.

TITLE: Votaniki Red Hot Poker Bulbs for Planting - Perennial, Kniphofia Red Hot Poker Flowering Bulbs for Long Lasting Beauty - Easy to Grow, Perfect for Any Garden (4 Pack)
DESCRIPTION: Votaniki Kniphofia Red Hot Poker Bulbs - Red Hot Poker is a type of flowering plant that produces long, striking spikes of bright, fiery red and yellow flowers atop tall stems. The flowers themselves are densely packed together and create a dramatic visual display, standing out against the greenery of the garden. These plants are relatively easy to care for, thriving in full sun and well-draining soil. They are also drought-tolerant, making them a great choice for gardens in drier climates. Aside from their visual appeal, the Red Hot Poker flower also attracts pollinators like hummingbirds and bees, making them a valuable addition to any garden ecosystem. Red Hot Poker are perennial, meaning they will come back year after year, providing reliable and long-lasting beauty in your garden. They typically bloom in mid to late summer, adding a vibrant splash of color during a time when many other flowers have already finished blooming. Red Hot Poker bulbs are also versatile in their use. They can be planted in mixed borders, rock gardens, or even as a striking accent plant in containers. They also pair well with other perennials, such as grasses or daylilies, creating a dynamic and visually interesting garden. When planting Red Hot Poker bulbs, it's important to make sure they have enough space to grow. They can reach up to 4 feet tall and should be planted 2 to 3 feet apart. The bulbs should be planted in the fall, about 4 inches deep and with the top of the bulb just below the soil surface

Dinnerplate Dahlia large, showy blooms and long vase life, it is sure to be a standout in any garden or flower arrangement.

TITLE: Votaniki Princess Margaret Rose Gladiolus Bulbs - Attract Pollinators, Long Blooming Period, Princess Margaret Rose Bulbs for Planting - Perfect for Cut Flower Arrangements (20 Pack)
DESCRIPTION: Votaniki Margaret Rose Gladiolus triple color play of rich golden yellow petals with orange margins and nearly-red ruffled edges, the Princess Margaret Rose Gladiolus is unlike any tall flowering wand you can imagine! These Gladiolas feature tall full flower spikes of alternating flowers that bloom from the bottom up for a long-lasting display! These Butterfly-friendly blooms can stand nearly 3-4 feet tall and provide impressive vertical color and waving sculptural texture to your landscape, to large container plantings and garden beds and borders! Each bulb produces multiple blooms, with up to 20 blossoms appearing on a single stem. The blossoms themselves are large and showy, measuring 4-5 inches in diameter. These gladiolus bulbs are easy to plant and care for, making them an ideal choice for both experienced gardeners and those just starting out. They prefer well-draining soil and should be planted in full sun or partial shade. Blooming occurs in mid to late summer, making them a perfect addition to any summer garden. Whether you're looking to add color to your garden or want to create a beautiful floral arrangement, the Princess Margaret Rose Gladiolus Bulbs are a perfect choice. With their showy blooms and easy care, they're sure to be a standout feature in any landscape or bouquet. When planting the bulbs, they should be spaced about 6 inches apart and planted at a depth of 4-6 inches. The soil should be well-draining. Once the bulbs have been planted, they should be watered regularly and kept moist but not waterlogged.

TITLE: Votaniki Florida Cardinal Caladium Bulbs - Angel Wings, Perennial Plant, Create Dramatic Displays with Large Florida Cardinal Leaves - Perfect for Indoors or Outdoors (3 Pack)
DESCRIPTION: Florida Cardinal Caladium produces large, heart-shaped leaves that feature bold splashes of red, pink, and green. They are tropical plants native to South America and are well-suited to warm, humid environments. The Florida Cardinal variety of caladiums is known for its bright and vivid coloration, making it a popular choice among gardeners and indoor plant enthusiasts alike. These Caladium bulbs are easy to grow and care for and can be planted in a variety of settings including pots, planters, and garden beds. In addition to their vibrant appearance, Florida Cardinal Caladiums are also highly versatile plants. They can be used to add color and texture to shady areas, as well as to brighten up sunnier spots in the garden. They are also great for adding interest to indoor spaces and can be used to create eye-catching displays on windowsills, bookshelves, and more. These caladium bulbs are typically planted in the spring or early summer after the threat of frost has passed. They prefer moist, well-draining soil and partial to full shade, though they can tolerate some sun if provided with enough water. Once planted, Florida Cardinal Caladiums require minimal maintenance. Regular watering and occasional fertilization will help keep the plants healthy and thriving. As the leaves begin to fade and die back in the fall, it's important to stop watering and allow the bulbs to go dormant. They can then be lifted and stored in a cool, dry place until it's time to plant them again in the spring.
